page.title: 05The Mills 0f Calbourne
page.content: {CALBOURNE MILL}owned by the Weeks family since 1878 is now a Show-place and Tourist Attraction. It is built of stone with all the equipment for milling still in working order. The Roller Mill equipment installed in 1894 is still in situ. The various outbuildings used for storage etc. are now used for Museums of rural life in days gone by and as a cafe with shopping area. { FULLING MILL,}now a stone built farmhouse, is on the site of the original mill, out of action before 1800, but used for treating cloth woven on the Island. The house retains many old features such as beams and open hearth fireplaces but no clear signs of its milling origin.
